newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: LME copper, aluminium stocks tipped to fall - trade.
newsitem.headline: LME copper, aluminium stocks tipped to fall - trade.

text.p: Copper and aluminium stocks in the London Metal Exchange (LME) should fall later on Friday, base metal dealers said.
Copper inventories were seen falling 2,000-3,000 tonnes while aluminium stocks were likely to fall by 5,000-6,000 tonnes when the LME report was released at 0900 GMT, they said.
"Copper should be down 2,000-3,000 tonnes," said a dealer for a European metal trading company. "I think aluminium will be down by up to 6,000 tonnes."
Metal brokers Brandeis said in its daily review that copper stocks should see a "drawdown of around 2,000-3,000 tonnes."
"I would say aluminium will be down another 5,000 tonnes," an aluminium dealer for a metal trading house in Singapore said.
Aluminium stocks in the LME's Singapore warehouse reached 17,325 tonnes in the LME's stocks report last Tuesday, down 125 tonnes from last Friday's report.
Copper stocks in the LME warehouse here may show another decline, dealers said.
The volume of copper in the LME's Singapore warehouse reached 52,175 tonnes in its stocks report last Tuesday, down 2,825 tonnes from the previous Friday's LME report.
Regional dealers said they saw three-month copper prices at 0200 GMT at around US$2,327/62 a tonne, unchanged from the late quote in London on Thursday.
Three-month aluminium was seen by the trade at 0200 GMT at about $1,665/68 a tonne, a shade down from the kerb close in London yesterday of $1,669 a tonne.
